context.original_query: Query 1: What's the latest between India and France?

summary1_1A.text: PM Modi and President Macron agreed to jointly develop modern nuclear reactors (including SMRs and AMRs), boost defense cooperation (missiles, submarines, engines for aircraft/helicopters), and collaborate on projects in third countries. They launched an India-France Roadmap on Artificial Intelligence, focused on safe, open, secure, and trustworthy AI. They commended progress on Scorpene submarine construction in India. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri emphasized the "deep personal trust" between the leaders, highlighting Macron's "exceptional gesture" of traveling with Modi.

summary2_1A.text: In February 2025, India and France deepened their strategic partnership through agreements on nuclear energy (SMRs, AMRs, Jaitapur plant progress), defense (Scorpene submarines, helicopter/jet engines, potential Pinaka MBRL acquisition), AI (India-France AI Roadmap, AI Action Summit), and Indo-Pacific cooperation (triangular development, Eurodrone MALE Programme - India as observer). Economic and cultural ties were boosted via startup collaboration (Station F), UPI expansion in France, and the Young Professional Scheme. This strengthens the strategic partnership, promotes economic growth and technological advancements, and enhances global influence. Challenges include implementation delays (Jaitapur), technological barriers, geopolitical risks regarding China, and bureaucratic hurdles.

memory.original_query: Query 1: What's the latest between India and France?
memory.summarizer_summary:
India and France have recently strengthened their strategic partnership through several key agreements and collaborations:

*   **Nuclear Energy:** PM Modi and President Macron agreed to jointly develop modern nuclear reactors, including Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) and Advanced Modular Reactors (AMRs). Progress was commended on the Jaitapur nuclear plant.
*   **Defense Cooperation:** Both countries will boost defense cooperation, focusing on missiles, submarines, and engines for aircraft and helicopters. Potential acquisition of Pinaka MBRL by India is also on the table.
*   **Artificial Intelligence:** An India-France Roadmap on Artificial Intelligence was launched, emphasizing safe, open, secure, and trustworthy AI. They also plan to collaborate on projects in third countries.
*   **Economic and Cultural Ties:** Economic and cultural ties are being boosted through startup collaboration (Station F), UPI expansion in France, and the Young Professional Scheme.

These developments aim to strengthen the strategic partnership, promote economic growth and technological advancements, and enhance global influence. Key sources include: [Indian Express](https://indianexpress.com/article/india/modi-france-visit-nuclear-reactors-missiles-engines-india-and-france-deepen-ties-9833093/), [Insights on India](https://www.insightsonindia.com/2025/02/13/india-france-relations/), [India Today](https://www.indiatoday.in/india/story/india-france-strengthen-defence-ties-with-air-maritime-cooperation-2679292-2025-02-13) and [Millennium Post](https://www.millenniumpost.in/big-stories/india-france-ties-reach-new-heights-as-modi-macron-seal-defence-trade-deals-598608).

perception.result_requirement: Summary of recent events or news between India and France
perception.reasoning: The query requires fetching and summarizing the latest news or developments between India and France. This information is not readily available in memory or globals. A tool-based approach is required to gather and summarize the information.

summarizer_snapshots.summary_output:
India and France have recently strengthened their strategic partnership through several key agreements and collaborations:

*   **Nuclear Energy:** PM Modi and President Macron agreed to jointly develop modern nuclear reactors, including Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) and Advanced Modular Reactors (AMRs). Progress was commended on the Jaitapur nuclear plant.
*   **Defense Cooperation:** Both countries will boost defense cooperation, focusing on missiles, submarines, and engines for aircraft and helicopters. Potential acquisition of Pinaka MBRL by India is also on the table.
*   **Artificial Intelligence:** An India-France Roadmap on Artificial Intelligence was launched, emphasizing safe, open, secure, and trustworthy AI. They also plan to collaborate on projects in third countries.
*   **Economic and Cultural Ties:** Economic and cultural ties are being boosted through startup collaboration (Station F), UPI expansion in France, and the Young Professional Scheme.

These developments aim to strengthen the strategic partnership, promote economic growth and technological advancements, and enhance global influence. Key sources include: [Indian Express](https://indianexpress.com/article/india/modi-france-visit-nuclear-reactors-missiles-engines-india-and-france-deepen-ties-9833093/), [Insights on India](https://www.insightsonindia.com/2025/02/13/india-france-relations/), [India Today](https://www.indiatoday.in/india/story/india-france-strengthen-defence-ties-with-air-maritime-cooperation-2679292-2025-02-13) and [Millennium Post](https://www.millenniumpost.in/big-stories/india-france-ties-reach-new-heights-as-modi-macron-seal-defence-trade-deals-598608).

session.final_summary: India and France have deepened their strategic partnership through agreements on nuclear energy, defense, and AI. PM Modi and President Macron agreed to jointly develop modern nuclear reactors, boost defense cooperation, and collaborate on AI. Economic and cultural ties were boosted via startup collaboration and UPI expansion in France.
